content:
Yes, the diverse performances of different countries at the Winter Olympics is one of the great things about the Games. Winter sports are not universal or equally accessible in all parts of the world, which leads to different countries developing expertise in different areas.

For example, Norway's long winters and mountainous terrain make skiing a natural fit for their athletes. Meanwhile, the Netherlands' cold, flat landscapes are ideal for speed skating on outdoor rinks.

The Winter Olympics therefore provide a unique opportunity for athletes from all corners of the globe to come together and showcase their abilities in a range of sports. The diversity of performances is a reminder of just how varied and fascinating the world can be.
